title: What is the final volume when 500 ml of gas is compressed by increasing it in pressure by 10%? - Quora

response.answer_text: Your question missed the information that temperature is constant. If I'm correct, let me assume the process goes on with constant temperature. Then (P1) (V1) = (P2) (V2). Here, take P1 AND V1 as P & V for convenience. Then P2 = P + 10% of P P2= 11/10 times of P V2 =? Apply and get the answer.
According to Boyle's law, P1 ×V1 = P2 ×V2…(When temperature is constant) Then, 1 × 500 = 1.1 × x Hence , X= 500÷ 1.1=454.55
